channel.title: Latest alerts uploaded to the Alert Hub
channel.description: This news feed lists the most recent alerts uploaded to the Alert Hub. Items in this news feed are valid CAP alerts but have not been filtered by language or any other criteria.
channel.dc:creator: Alert Hub (eliot.christian@redCross.org)

item.title: Flood Advisory issued August 08 at 7:41PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
item.description: THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE IN FORT WORTH HAS ISSUED A* FLOOD ADVISORY FOR MINOR FLOODING IN POOR DRAINAGE AREAS FOR...GRAYSON COUNTY IN NORTH CENTRAL TEXAS...COOKE COUNTY IN NORTH CENTRAL TEXAS...* UNTIL 1045 PM CDT* AT 740 PM CDT...DOPPLER RADAR INDICATED THUNDERSTORMS THAT WEREPRODUCING HEAVY RAINFALL ACROSS THE AREA. EXCESSIVE RUNOFF FROMTHESE THUNDERSTORMS WILL CAUSE MINOR FLOODING. AREAS THAT ARE LOWLYING OR USUALLY EXPERIENCE POOR DRAINAGE ARE MOST LIKELY TOEXPERIENCE FLOODING. THIS MEANS SOME LOW WATER CROSSINGS IN THEREGION MAY BECOME IMPASSABLE. UP TO TWO INCHES OF RAIN HAVEALREADY FALLEN.ADDITIONAL RAINFALL OF ONE TO TWO INCHES IS EXPECTED OVER THE AREA.THIS ADDITIONAL RAIN WILL MAKE MINOR FLOODING.
item.dc:creator: w-nws.webmaster@noaa.gov

item.title: Flood Warning issued August 05 at 7:25PM CDT until August 08 at 2:05PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
item.description: ...The National Weather Service in St. Louis has issued a floodwarning for the following rivers in Missouri...Middle Fabius River near EwingThe National Weather Service in St. Louis has issued a* Flood Warning for the Middle Fabius River near Ewing* from Saturday evening to Monday afternoon.* At 6:30 PM Friday the stage was 5.2 feet.* Flood stage is 12.0 feet.* Minor flooding is forecast.* The river is forecast to rise above flood stage by tomorrow lateevening and crest near 12.4 feet by Sunday morning. The river willfall below flood stage by Sunday early afternoon.&&Fld Latest 7 a.m. ForecastLOCATION Stg Obs Stg 08/06 08/07 08/08 08/09 08/10Middle Fabius RiverEwing 12.0 5.19 9.3 12.4 8.2 5.2 3.9&&

item.title: severe thunderstorm watch in effect veille d'orages violents en vigueur
item.description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing damaging wind gusts, damaging hail and heavy rain.Severe thunderstorms are possible this evening into the overnight period.###Very large hail can damage property, break windows, dent vehicles and cause serious injury. Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road.Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to storm@ec.gc.ca or tweet reports to #ABStorm. Les conditions sont propices à la formation d'orages dangereux pouvant produire des rafales causant des dommages, de la grêle causant des dommages et de la pluie forte.Il y a un risque d'orages violents ce soir et au cours de la nuit.###De la très grosse grêle peut endommager des biens, briser des fenêtres, bosseler des véhicules et causer des blessures graves. De très fortes rafales peuvent endommager des bâtiments, déraciner des arbres et emporter de gros véhicules hors de la route.Une veille d'orages violents est émise lorsque les conditions atmosphériques sont propices à la formation d'orages qui pourraient s'accompagner d'au moins un des éléments suivants : grosse grêle, vents destructeurs ou pluies torrentielles.Veuillez continuer à surveiller les alertes et les prévisions émises par Environnement Canada. Pour signaler du temps violent, envoyez un courriel à storm@ec.gc.ca ou publiez un gazouillis avec le mot-clic #ABMétéo.
item.dc:creator: cap-pac@canada.ca

item.title: severe thunderstorm warning in effect alerte d'orages violents en vigueur
item.description: At 4:52 p.m. MDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain.###Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes.Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. À 16h52 HAR, les météorologues d’Environnement Canada surveillent un orage violent pouvant produire des rafales très fortes, de la grêle pouvant atteindre la taille d’une pièce de cinq cents et de la pluie forte.###Les pluies torrentielles peuvent causer des crues soudaines et une accumulation d'eau sur les routes. De la grosse grêle peut endommager des biens et causer des blessures. N'oubliez pas que les orages violents peuvent produire des tornades.Une alerte d'orages violents est émise lorsqu'il y a ou qu'il y aura des orages qui s'accompagnent ou qui s'accompagneront probablement d'au moins un des éléments suivants : grosse grêle, vents destructeurs ou pluies torrentielles.
item.dc:creator: cap-pac@canada.ca

item.title: severe thunderstorm warning in effect alerte d'orages violents en vigueur
item.description: At 7:07 p.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain.###Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes.Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. À 19h07 HAC, les météorologues d’Environnement Canada surveillent un orage violent pouvant produire des rafales très fortes, de la grêle pouvant atteindre la taille d’une pièce de cinq cents et de la pluie forte.###Les pluies torrentielles peuvent causer des crues soudaines et une accumulation d'eau sur les routes. De fortes rafales peuvent projeter des objets non fixés, endommager des bâtiments peu solides, arracher des branches d'arbres et renverser de gros véhicules. Tout orage qui se formera s'accompagnera probablement de nombreux éclairs. N'oubliez pas que les orages violents peuvent produire des tornades.Une alerte d'orages violents est émise lorsqu'il y a ou qu'il y aura des orages qui s'accompagnent ou qui s'accompagneront probablement d'au moins un des éléments suivants : grosse grêle, vents destructeurs ou pluies torrentielles.
item.dc:creator: cap-pac@canada.ca

item.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 5:47PM EDT until July 31 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
item.description: ...A LINE OF STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL AFFECT NORTHEASTERN GATES...NORTHWESTERN CAMDEN...NORTHWESTERN CURRITUCK...AND SOUTHWESTERN ISLEOF WIGHT COUNTIES...THE WESTERN CITY OF CHESAPEAKE...THE SOUTHERNCITY OF PORTSMOUTH AND THE CITY OF SUFFOLK...AT 547 PM EDT...RADAR INDICATED STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WERE LOCATEDALONG A LINE EXTENDING FROM NEAR SEDLEY TO NEAR DEEP CREEK. MOVEMENTWAS NORTHEAST AT 10 MPH.WIND GUSTS IN EXCESS OF 30 MPH AND RAINFALL AMOUNTS OF 1 TO 2 INCHESARE POSSIBLE WITH THESE STORMS.LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... WINDSOR...HOLLAND...DOWNTOWNSUFFOLK...DEEP CREEK...CHESAPEAKE...PORTSMOUTH...SUFFOLK...CORAPEAKE...BOWERSHILL...CARRSVILLE...WHALEYVILLE... DRIVER...CRADOCK...ZUNI...KINGSFORK...WESTERN BRANCH...HAZELTON...SUFFOLK AIRPORT...INDIKA AND LEESMILL.MOTORISTS SHOULD USE EXTRA CAUTION IN THE VICINITY OF THESE STORMS.BE PREPARED FOR RAPID CHANGES IN WEATHER AND ROAD CONDITIONS. HEAVYRAIN COULD CAUSE PONDING OF WATER ON ROADS...AND POSSIBLE MINORFLOODING OF DITCHES AND POOR DRAINAGE AREAS.FREQUENT CLOUD TO GROUND LIGHTNING IS OCCURRING WITH THIS STORM.LIGHTNING CAN STRIKE MORE THAN 10 MILES AWAY FROM A THUNDERSTORM.SEEK A SAFE SHELTER INSIDE A BUILDING OR VEHICLE.
item.dc:creator: w-nws.webmaster@noaa.gov

item.description: ...SIGNIFICANT WEATHER ADVISORY FOR FREQUENT TO EXCESSIVE LIGHTNINGAND 45 TO 55 MPH WINDS FOR CENTRAL PALM BEACH COUNTY UNTIL 430 PMEDT...* AT 341 PM EDT...DOPPLER RADAR WAS TRACKING A STRONG THUNDERSTORMOVER LOXAHATCHEE GROVES...OR NEAR WELLINGTON...MOVING SOUTHWEST AT10 MPH.* THE PRIMARY IMPACTS WILL BE FREQUENT TO EXCESSIVE LIGHTNING ANDGUSTY WINDS OF 45 TO 55 MPH. item.title: Flood Advisory issued July 25 at 3:02PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
item.description: ...THE FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM AKDT WEDNESDAYFOR THE CHENA RIVER UPSTREAM OF NORDALE ROAD......* THE CHENA RIVER EAST OF NORDALE ROAD REMAINS NEAR BANKFULL WITHMINOR FLOODING IN SOME LOCATIONS. LOW LYING BOAT LAUNCHES ANDRIVER ACCESS ROADS IN THE CHENA RECREATION AREA ARE FLOODED ANDMANY HAVE EROSION DAMAGE TO THE ROADS. THERE IS ALSO FLOODING ATTHE GRANITE TORS DAY USE AREA...THE MILE 37.5 SHOOTING RANGE ANDTHE MILE 41 STILES CREEK EXTENSION TRAILHEAD. THE PORTIONS OF THESPILLWAY UPSTREAM OF THE MOOSE CREEK DAM AREA ALSO FLOODED. THERIVER IS NOW FALLING FROM TWO RIVERS EAST AND SHOULD CONTINUEFALLING SLOWLY OVER THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS. FROM THE MOOSE CREEKDAM DOWNSTREAM THE CHENA RIVER WILL REMAIN HIGH THROUGH WEDNESDAYAS WATER SLOWLY DRAINS OUT FROM BEHIND THE DAM.* IN THE STEAMBOAT LANDING SUBDIVISION IN NORTH POLE...WATER LEVELSARE EXPECTED TO REMAIN AT MINOR FLOOD STAGE THROUGH WEDNESDAY.SEVERAL INCHES OF WATER WILL CONTINUE TO CROSS FREEMAN ROAD. RIVERWATER WILL INUNDATE SOME YARDS IN THE SUBDIVISION...ANDGROUNDWATER FLOODING WILL OCCUR IN SOME BASEMENTS.* THE U.S. ARMY CORPS OF ENGINEERS ALASKA DISTRICT IS CURRENTLYOPERATING THE MOOSE CREEK DAM. FLOOD CONTROL GATES AT THE DAMSTARTED REGULATING THE CHENA RIVER AT 6:00 PM ON 20 JULY 2016.THE DAM WILL BE REGULATING THE CHENA RIVER SO THAT FLOW DOES NOTEXCEED 12000 CUBIC FEET PER SECOND IN DOWNTOWN FAIRBANKS.GROUNDWATER WILL RISE TO NEAR THE GROUND SURFACE FOR SEVERALTHOUSAND FEET WEST OF THE MOOSE CREEK DAM WITH MINOR FLOODINGPOSSIBLE. RIVER NAVIGATION THROUGH THE MOOSE CREEK DAM ISUNAVAILABLE DURING OPERATIONS.
item.dc:creator: w-nws.webmaster@noaa.gov

item.title: Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 6:03AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
item.description: ...THE FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM AKDT SUNDAY FORTHE CHENA RIVER FROM THE MOOSE CREEK DAM UPSTREAM...THE CHENA RIVER REMAINS AT BANKFULL AND ABOVE FLOOD STAGE INSOME LOCATIONS...BUT IS FALLING FROM NEAR HUNTS CREEK UPSTREAM.THE CHENA RIVER AT THE GRANITE TORS CAMPGROUND HAS FALLEN TO20.0 FEET WHICH IS 0.5 FOOT ABOVE MINOR FLOOD STAGE. THE CHENARIVER AT THE GRANITE TORS CAMPGROUND IS EXPECTED TO FALL TO BELOWFLOOD STAGE AROUND NOON TODAY.THE CREST ON THE CHENA RIVER HAS MOVED DOWNSTREAM FROM HUNTS CREEK.THE CHENA RIVER NEAR HUNTS CREEK IS EXPECTED TO FALL TO BELOWMINOR FLOOD STAGE LATER THIS MORNING.AT THE MOOSE CREEK DAM...THE WATER LEVEL REMAINS AT 24.8 FEET WHICHIS 0.3 FOOT ABOVE MINOR FLOOD STAGE. THE WATER IS EXPECTED TO REMAINAT THAT LEVEL THROUGH THE WEEKEND. WATER HAS INUNDATED MANY OF THERIVER ACCESS ROADS IN THE CHENA RIVER RECREATION AREA...THE STILESCREEK SHOOTING RANGE...AND THE COMPEAU TRAILHEAD.IN THE STEAMBOAT LANDING SUBDIVISION IN NORTH POLE...WATER LEVELSARE EXPECTED TO REMAIN AT MINOR FLOOD STAGE THROUGH THE WEEKEND.SEVERAL INCHES OF WATER WILL CONTINUE TO CROSS FREEMAN ROAD...RIVERWATER WILL INUNDATE SOME YARDS IN THE SUBDIVISION...AND GROUNDWATERFLOODING WILL OCCUR IN SOME BASEMENTS.THE U.S. ARMY CORPS OF ENGINEERS ALASKA DISTRICT IS CURRENTLYOPERATING THE MOOSE CREEK DAM. FLOOD CONTROL GATES AT THE DAMSTARTED REGULATING THE CHENA RIVER AT 6:00 PM ON 20 JULY 2016. THEDAM WILL BE REGULATING THE CHENA RIVER SO THAT FLOW DOES NOT EXCEED12000 CUBIC FEET PER SECOND IN DOWNTOWN FAIRBANKS. GROUNDWATER WILLRISE TO NEAR THE GROUND SURFACE FOR SEVERAL THOUSAND FEET WEST OFTHE MOOSE CREEK DAM WITH MINOR FLOODING POSSIBLE. RIVER NAVIGATIONTHROUGH THE MOOSE CREEK DAM IS UNAVAILABLE DURING OPERATIONS.
item.dc:creator: w-nws.webmaster@noaa.gov

item.description: ...SIGNIFICANT WEATHER ADVISORY FOR FREQUENT TO EXCESSIVELIGHTNING...SMALL HAIL AND 45 TO 55 MPH WINDS FOR WESTERN BROWARD ANDSOUTH CENTRAL PALM BEACH COUNTIES UNTIL 1000 PM EDT...* AT 918 PM EDT...NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE METEOROLOGISTS DETECTED ALINE OF STRONG THUNDERSTORMS ALONG A LINE EXTENDING FROM 6 MILESEAST OF HOLEY LAND WILDLIFE REFUGE TO NEAR MICCOSUKEE SERVICEPLAZA...AND MOVING SOUTHEAST AT 10 TO 15 MPH.* FREQUENT TO EXCESSIVE LIGHTNING...GUSTY WINDS FROM 45 TO 55 MPH...SMALL HAIL...TORRENTIAL DOWNPOURS...OR A COMBINATION OF THESE AREPOSSIBLE. LIGHTNING IS THE NUMBER ONE WEATHER RELATED KILLER INFLORIDA. TREES AND OPEN SHELTERS OFFER NO PROTECTION. THESE WINDSCAN DOWN SMALL TREE LIMBS AND BRANCHES...AND BLOW AROUND UNSECUREDSMALL OBJECTS. SEEK SHELTER IN A SAFE BUILDING UNTIL THE STORMPASSES.* LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE...INTERSECTION ALLIGATOR ALLEY AND MIAMI CANAL...MILE MARKER 30 ONALLIGATOR ALLEY...LOXAHATCHEE NWR AND WEST BROWARD REC. AREA ONALLIGATOR ALLEY.

item.description: ...THE FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1100 PM CDTSATURDAY FOR SOUTHEASTERN WINNEBAGO...SOUTHERN BOONE AND SOUTHWESTERNMCHENRY COUNTIES...AT 718 PM CDT...WIDESPREAD FLOODING WAS OCCURRING ACROSS THE WARNEDAREA. item.title: Flood Advisory issued July 20 at 7:29AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
item.description: THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE IN FAIRBANKS HAS EXTENDED THE* FLOOD ADVISORY FOR...THE CHENA RIVER FROM NORTH POLE UPSTREAM...* UNTIL 245 PM AKDT FRIDAY* FROM 1 TO 3 INCHES OF RAIN FELL OVER PORTIONS OF THE CHENA RIVERBASIN EARLIER THIS WEEK. RUNOFF FROM THE RAINFALL HAS CAUSED THECHENA RIVER FROM NORTH POLE AND UPSTREAM TO RISE TO MINOR FLOODSTAGE IN SOME LOW LYING AREAS.* AS OF 8 AM WEDNESDAY...THE CHENA RIVER BELOW HUNTS FORK IN TWORIVERS IS REPORTING A STAGE OF 17.3 FEET WHICH IS JUST ABOVE MINORFLOOD STAGE. THE CHENA RIVER BELOW HUNTS FORK IS FORECAST TO CRESTTHIS MORNING AND THEN BEGIN TO RECEDE THIS AFTERNOON. THE CRESTWILL CONTINUE DOWNRIVER AND PASS THROUGH THE MOOSE CREEK DAM INNORTH POLE ON THURSDAY. FURTHER UPSTREAM...THE CHENA RIVER HASFALLEN BELOW MINOR FLOOD STAGE AT THE GRANITE TORS CAMPGROUND ANDWILL CONTINUE TO RECEDE THROUGH THURSDAY.* IN THE STEAMBOAT LANDING SUBDIVISION IN NORTH POLE...WATER LEVELSARE EXPECTED TO RISE TO MINOR FLOOD STAGE TODAY AND IT IS LIKELYSEVERAL INCHES OF WATER WILL CROSS FREEMAN ROAD AND INUNDATE SOMEYARDS IN THE SUBDIVISION.* IN FAIRBANKS...WATER LEVELS WILL BE NEAR BANKFULL FOR THEREMAINDER OF THE WEEK. SOME PATHS NEAR THE RIVER WILL BE INUNDATEDAND THERE WILL BE LIMITED CLEARANCE FOR BOAT TRAFFIC UNDER SOMEBRIDGES.* IN ADDITION TO HIGH WATER THERE IS INCREASED DEBRIS IN THE RIVERAND BANK EROSION.

item.title: avertissement de grains en vigueur squall warning in effect
item.description: Des grains accompagnés de rafales jusqu’à 40 noeuds sont attendus ou se produisent dans le secteur.###Veuillez continuer à surveiller les alertes et les prévisions émises par Environnement Canada. Pour plus d’information, écoutez la station radio de la Garde côtière canadienne ou Radiométéo. Squalls with wind gusts up to 40 knots are expected or occurring in the area.###Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
item.dc:creator: cap-pac@canada.ca

item.title: severe thunderstorm warning in effect alerte d'orages violents en vigueur
item.description: ###Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads.Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. ###Les pluies torrentielles peuvent causer des crues soudaines et une accumulation d'eau sur les routes.Une alerte d'orages violents est émise lorsqu'il y a ou qu'il y aura des orages qui s'accompagnent ou qui s'accompagneront probablement d'au moins un des éléments suivants : grosse grêle, vents destructeurs ou pluies torrentielles.
item.dc:creator: cap-pac@canada.ca

item.description: ...The flood warning continues for the following rivers inMinnesota...Mississippi River At Aitkin affecting Aitkin and Crow Wing CountiesMississippi River Near Fort Ripley affecting Morrison and Crow WingCountiesSnake River Near Pine City affecting Pine County.Heavy rain from earlier in the week has brought high waterlevels along rivers across parts of central and northeastMinnesota...including the Mississippi and Snake Rivers.The rivers are forecast to crest within the next few days...thensubside through the weekend into early next week.The Flood Warning continues forThe Mississippi River At Aitkin.* At 7:30 PM Thursday the stage was 14.1 feet.* Flood stage is 13.0 feet.* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.* Forecast...The river will continue rising to near 14.2 feetafter midnight tonight. The river will fall below flood stageSunday early afternoon.* At 15.0 feet...A few homes become surrounded by water in theCedarbrook neighborhood near Eagle Rd. The Aitkin city park becomesflooded..This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.9 feet on May 3 2008.&&

item.title: severe thunderstorm watch in effect veille d'orages violents en vigueur
item.description: ###Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads.Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to storm@ec.gc.ca or tweet reports to #SKStorm. ###Les pluies torrentielles peuvent causer des crues soudaines et une accumulation d'eau sur les routes.Une veille d'orages violents est émise lorsque les conditions atmosphériques sont propices à la formation d'orages qui pourraient s'accompagner d'au moins un des éléments suivants : grosse grêle, vents destructeurs ou pluies torrentielles.Veuillez continuer à surveiller les alertes et les prévisions émises par Environnement Canada. Pour signaler du temps violent, envoyez un courriel à storm@ec.gc.ca ou publiez un gazouillis avec le mot-clic #SKMétéo.
item.dc:creator: cap-pac@canada.ca

item.title: severe thunderstorm watch in effect veille d'orages violents en vigueur
item.description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain.###Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads.Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to storm@ec.gc.ca or tweet reports to #ABStorm. Les conditions sont propices à la formation d'orages violents pouvant produire des rafales fortes, de la grêle de grosse taille et de la pluie forte.###De la grosse grêle peut endommager des biens et causer des blessures. De fortes rafales peuvent projeter des objets non fixés, endommager des bâtiments peu solides, arracher des branches d'arbres et renverser de gros véhicules. Les pluies torrentielles peuvent causer des crues soudaines et une accumulation d'eau sur les routes.Une veille d'orages violents est émise lorsque les conditions atmosphériques sont propices à la formation d'orages qui pourraient s'accompagner d'au moins un des éléments suivants : grosse grêle, vents destructeurs ou pluies torrentielles.Veuillez continuer à surveiller les alertes et les prévisions émises par Environnement Canada. Pour signaler du temps violent, envoyez un courriel à storm@ec.gc.ca ou publiez un gazouillis avec le mot-clic #ABMétéo.
item.dc:creator: cap-pac@canada.ca

item.title: heat warning in effect avertissement de chaleur en vigeur
item.description: ###While heat can put everyone at risk from heat illnesses, health risks are greatest for - older adults; - infants and young children; - people with chronic illnesses such as breathing difficulties, heart conditions or psychiatric illnesses; - people who work in the heat; - people who exercise in the heat; - homeless people; and - people without access to air conditioning.Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion.Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to storm.ontario@ec.gc.ca or tweet reports to #ONStorm. ###La chaleur nous rend tous vulnérables aux malaises provoqués par la chaleur, mais les risques sont plus grands pour - les personnes âgées - les nourrissons et les jeunes enfants - les personnes souffrant de maladies chroniques, comme des difficultés respiratoires, des maladies mentales et des troubles cardiaques - les personnes qui travaillent à la chaleur - les personnes qui s’entraînent à la chaleur - les personnes n'ayant pas accès à l'air climatisé et - les sans-abri.Un avertissement de chaleur est émis lorsque des conditions très chaudes ou humides devraient présenter un risque élevé de malaises liés à la chaleur, comme les coups de chaleur et l'épuisement dû à la chaleur.Veuillez continuer à surveiller les alertes et les prévisions émises par Environnement Canada. Pour signaler du temps violent, envoyez un courriel à storm.ontario@ec.gc.ca ou publiez un gazouillis avec le mot-clic #ONMétéo.
item.dc:creator: cap-pac@canada.ca

item.title: heat warning in effect avertissement de chaleur en vigeur
item.description:
One more humid night is in store with overnight minimum temperatures near 18 to 20 degrees.The passage of a cold front Thursday will bring an end to the heat for most areas, although some regions may still experience high temperatures near 28 degrees ahead of the front.###While heat can put everyone at risk from heat illnesses, health risks are greatest for - older adults; - infants and young children; - people with chronic illnesses such as breathing difficulties, heart conditions or psychiatric illnesses; - people who work in the heat; - people who exercise in the heat; - homeless people; and - people without access to air conditioning.Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion.Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to storm.ontario@ec.gc.ca or tweet reports to #ONStorm. Encore une nuit humide perspective avec des températures minimales de près de 18 à 20 degrés.

Le passage d'un front froid jeudi mettra fin à la chaleur dans la plupart des secteurs, bien que certains secteurs pourraient encore connaître des maximums de près de 28 degrés à l'avant du front.###La chaleur nous rend tous vulnérables aux malaises provoqués par la chaleur, mais les risques sont plus grands pour - les personnes âgées - les nourrissons et les jeunes enfants - les personnes souffrant de maladies chroniques, comme des difficultés respiratoires, des maladies mentales et des troubles cardiaques - les personnes qui travaillent à la chaleur - les personnes qui s’entraînent à la chaleur - les personnes n'ayant pas accès à l'air climatisé et - les sans-abri.Un avertissement de chaleur est émis lorsque des conditions très chaudes ou humides devraient présenter un risque élevé de malaises liés à la chaleur, comme les coups de chaleur et l'épuisement dû à la chaleur.Veuillez continuer à surveiller les alertes et les prévisions émises par Environnement Canada. Pour signaler du temps violent, envoyez un courriel à storm.ontario@ec.gc.ca ou publiez un gazouillis avec le mot-clic #ONMétéo.
item.dc:creator: cap-pac@canada.ca

item.title: severe thunderstorm watch in effect veille d'orages violents en vigueur
item.description: Scattered thunderstorms are expected to track eastward across the regions this afternoon and early evening. One or two of these storms could be locally severe with damaging winds, large hail, and torrential downpours.###Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to storm.ontario@ec.gc.ca or tweet reports to #ONStorm.For more information:http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html. Des orages dispersés devraient se déplacer vers l'est et traverser les régions cet après-midi et en début de soirée. Un ou deux de ces orages pourraient être violents par endroits et s'accompagner de vents destructeurs, de la grosse grêle et des pluies torrentielles.###Une veille d'orages violents est émise lorsque les conditions atmosphériques sont propices à la formation d'orages qui pourraient s'accompagner d'au moins un des éléments suivants : grosse grêle, vents destructeurs ou pluies torrentielles.Veuillez continuer à surveiller les alertes et les prévisions émises par Environnement Canada. Pour signaler du temps violent, envoyez un courriel à storm.ontario@ec.gc.ca ou publiez un gazouillis avec le mot-clic #ONMétéo.Pour obtenir plus de renseignements :http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/french/beprepared/beprepared_fr.html.
item.dc:creator: cap-pac@canada.ca

item.title: special weather statement in effect bulletin météorologique spécial en vigueur
item.description: Rain, at times heavy, will gradually taper to drizzle on Tuesday. Additional rainfall amounts of 20 to 40 mm are forecast, with the majority of these amounts expected tonight.###Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to weatherNLWO@ec.gc.ca or tweet reports to #NLwx. La pluie, parfois forte, se changera graduellement en bruine mardi. On prévoit une quantité de pluie additionnelle de 20 à 40 mm, la majeure partie de cette pluie étant attendue ce soir et cette nuit.###Veuillez continuer à surveiller les alertes et les prévisions émises par Environnement Canada. Pour signaler du temps violent, envoyez un courriel à weatherNLWO@ec.gc.ca ou publiez un gazouillis avec le mot-clic #NLMétéo.
item.dc:creator: cap-pac@canada.ca

item.title: severe thunderstorm warning in effect alerte d'orages violents en vigueur
item.description: At 1:59 p.m. CST, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain.This severe thunderstorm is near Estlin, 25 km south of Regina, and is tracking towards Regina.###Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury.Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. À 13h59 HNC, les météorologues d’Environnement Canada surveillent un orage violent pouvant produire des rafales très fortes, de la grêle pouvant atteindre la taille d’une pièce de cinq cents et de la pluie forte.Cet orage violent se trouve près d'Estlin, à 25 km au sud de Regina, et se déplace en direction de Regina.###Les pluies torrentielles peuvent causer des crues soudaines et une accumulation d'eau sur les routes. De la grosse grêle peut endommager des biens et causer des blessures.Une alerte d'orages violents est émise lorsqu'il y a ou qu'il y aura des orages qui s'accompagnent ou qui s'accompagneront probablement d'au moins un des éléments suivants : grosse grêle, vents destructeurs ou pluies torrentielles.
item.dc:creator: cap-pac@canada.ca

item.title: special weather statement in effect bulletin météorologique spécial en vigueur
item.description: A low pressure system is forecast to pass near or across the southeastern tip of the Avalon Peninsula Monday evening. Rain, at times heavy, will develop on Monday as the low approaches and will continue through Monday night. Forecast rainfall amounts are generally in the 30 to 50 millimetre range but there is potential for embedded thundershowers which could result in locally higher amounts. As a result, the public is advised to monitor future forecasts from Environment Canada as rainfall warnings may be required.###Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to weatherNLWO@ec.gc.ca or tweet reports to #NLwx. Une dépression devrait envahir ou effleurer l'extrémité sud-est de la péninsule d'Avalon lundi soir. La pluie, parfois forte, commencera à tomber lundi à l'approche de la dépression et continuera lundi soir et dans la nuit de lundi à mardi. Les quantités de pluie prévues devraient être de l'ordre de 30 à 50 mm; toutefois, il y a un risque d'orages incrustés, ce qui pourrait donner des quantités de pluie plus importantes par endroits. Par conséquent, on recommande au public de surveiller les prévisions d'Environnement Canada, car des avertissements de pluie pourraient être émis.###Veuillez continuer à surveiller les alertes et les prévisions émises par Environnement Canada. Pour signaler du temps violent, envoyez un courriel à weatherNLWO@ec.gc.ca ou publiez un gazouillis avec le mot-clic #NLMétéo.
item.dc:creator: cap-pac@canada.ca

item.title: severe thunderstorm watch in effect veille d'orages violents en vigueur
item.description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing damaging wind gusts and damaging hail.Thunderstorms have developed along the foothills as a low pressure system develops in Alberta this afternoon. These thunderstorms will continue to grow and move east. Some of these thunderstorms may become severe, with strong winds and large hail the main threats with these thunderstorms. These thunderstorms will persist into the late evening and move east towards the Alberta/Saskatchewan border. The severe thunderstorm watch area may be expanded later this afternoon as the system develops.###Very large hail can damage property, break windows, dent vehicles and cause serious injury. Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes.Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to storm@ec.gc.ca or tweet reports to #ABStorm. Les conditions sont propices à la formation d'orages dangereux pouvant produire des rafales causant des dommages et de la grêle causant des dommages.Des orages se sont formés le long des contreforts alors qu'une dépression se forme sur l'Alberta cet après-midi. Ces orages continueront de s'amplifier et de se diriger vers l'est. Certains de ces orages pourraient devenir violents, et les principaux risques sont des vents forts et de la grosse grêle. Ces orages persisteront jusqu'en fin de soirée et se dirigeront vers l'est en direction de la frontière séparant l'Alberta et la Saskatchewan. Le secteur visé par la veille d'orage violent pourrait être élargi à d'autres régions plus tard cet après-midi à mesure que ce système évoluera.###De la très grosse grêle peut endommager des biens, briser des fenêtres, bosseler des véhicules et causer des blessures graves. De très fortes rafales peuvent endommager des bâtiments, déraciner des arbres et emporter de gros véhicules hors de la route. N'oubliez pas que les orages violents peuvent produire des tornades.Une veille d'orages violents est émise lorsque les conditions atmosphériques sont propices à la formation d'orages qui pourraient s'accompagner d'au moins un des éléments suivants : grosse grêle, vents destructeurs ou pluies torrentielles.Veuillez continuer à surveiller les alertes et les prévisions émises par Environnement Canada. Pour signaler du temps violent, envoyez un courriel à storm@ec.gc.ca ou publiez un gazouillis avec le mot-clic #ABMétéo.
item.dc:creator: cap-pac@canada.ca

item.title: Flood Warning issued July 08 at 6:11PM CDT until July 09 at 12:07PM CDT by NWS Nashville
item.description: ...Flood Warning extended until 07/09 12:07...The Flood Warning continues forThe Red River At Port Royal* Until 07/09 12:07.* At 05PM Friday the stage was 36.2 feet and falling.* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.* Flood stage is 30.0 feet.* The river will continue to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning.* At 35.0 feet...Water begins to flood Port Royal Rd near the Highway 238bridge.* At 33.0 feet...Flooding of Port Royal State Park begins.* At 30.0 feet...Low lying agricultural areas along the Red River from theKentucky State Line to Adams, past Port Royal State Park, and on the SulpherFork from near Springfield to near Cedar Hill, to Port Royal State Park beginto flood.* At 17.0 feet...The public access parking lot at Port Royal State Park iscompletely inundated.* At 11.0 feet...Water begins to inundate the public access parking lot andpicnic area at Port Royal State Park.&&
item.dc:creator: w-nws.webmaster@noaa.gov

item.title: severe thunderstorm watch in effect veille d'orages violents en vigueur
item.description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain.Thunderstorms over east-central parts of the province have the potential to produce severe weather this evening.###Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes.Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to storm@ec.gc.ca or tweet reports to #ABStorm. Les conditions sont propices à la formation d'orages violents pouvant produire des rafales fortes, de la grêle de grosse taille et de la pluie forte.Les orages sur le centre-est de la province pourraient occasionner du temps violent ce soir.###N'oubliez pas que les orages violents peuvent produire des tornades.Veuillez continuer à surveiller les alertes et les prévisions émises par Environnement Canada. Pour signaler du temps violent, envoyez un courriel à storm@ec.gc.ca ou publiez un gazouillis avec le mot-clic #ABMétéo.
item.dc:creator: cap-pac@canada.ca

item.title: severe thunderstorm warning in effect alerte d'orages violents en vigueur
item.description: At 7:25 p.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, toonie to ping pong ball size hail and heavy rain.###Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes.Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. À 19h25 HAE, les météorologues d’Environnement Canada surveillent un orage violent pouvant produire des rafales très fortes, de la grêle de la taille d'un 2 dollars à une balle de ping-pong et de la pluie forte.###N'oubliez pas que les orages violents peuvent produire des tornades.Une alerte d'orages violents est émise lorsqu'il y a ou qu'il y aura des orages qui s'accompagnent ou qui s'accompagneront probablement d'au moins un des éléments suivants : grosse grêle, vents destructeurs ou pluies torrentielles.
item.dc:creator: cap-pac@canada.ca

item.title: severe thunderstorm warning in effect alerte d'orages violents en vigueur
item.description: At 7:16 p.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain.A line of thunderstorms that came ashore from Lake Huron is tracking eastward at 50 km/h. These thunderstorms are capable of producing wind gusts to 90 km/h, heavy downpours and large hail.###Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes.Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. À 19h16 HAE, les météorologues d’Environnement Canada surveillent un orage violent pouvant produire des rafales très fortes, de la grêle pouvant atteindre la taille d’une pièce de cinq cents et de la pluie forte.Une ligne d'orages qui a envahit les terres depuis le lac Huron se déplace vers l'est à 50 km/h. Ces orages pourraient s'accompagner de rafales à 90 km/h, de grosse grêle et de pluies torrentielles.###N'oubliez pas que les orages violents peuvent produire des tornades.Une alerte d'orages violents est émise lorsqu'il y a ou qu'il y aura des orages qui s'accompagnent ou qui s'accompagneront probablement d'au moins un des éléments suivants : grosse grêle, vents destructeurs ou pluies torrentielles.
item.dc:creator: cap-pac@canada.ca

item.title: severe thunderstorm warning in effect alerte d'orages violents en vigueur severe thunderstorm warning ended alerte d'orages violents annulée
item.description:
At 4:07 p.m. MDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a line of severe thunderstorms capable of producing strong wind gusts, nickel to ping pong ball size hail and heavy rain.This line of thunderstorms is almost stationary from near Lamont to near Rich Lake. Individual cells within the line are intermittently producing hail up to the size of loonies and locally heavy downpours.###Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes.Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. À 16h07 HAR, les météorologues d’Environnement Canada surveillent une ligne d'orages violents pouvant produire des rafales fortes, de la grêle de la taille d’une pièce de cinq cents à une balle de ping-pong et de la pluie forte.Cette ligne d'orages quasi stationnaire s'étend depuis un point près de Lamont jusqu'à un point près de Rich Lake.

Les cellules individuelles dans la ligne produisent par moments des grêlons atteignant jusqu'à la taille d'une pièce d'un dollar, ainsi que des pluies torrentielles par endroits.###N'oubliez pas que les orages violents peuvent produire des tornades.Une alerte d'orages violents est émise lorsqu'il y a ou qu'il y aura des orages qui s'accompagnent ou qui s'accompagneront probablement d'au moins un des éléments suivants : grosse grêle, vents destructeurs ou pluies torrentielles. ### ###
item.dc:creator: cap-pac@canada.ca

item.title: severe thunderstorm warning in effect alerte d'orages violents en vigueur
item.description:
At 3:47 p.m. MDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a line of severe thunderstorms capable of producing strong wind gusts, nickel to ping pong ball size hail and heavy rain.This line of thunderstorms is almost stationary from areas around southwest Edmonton to near Rich Lake. Individual cells within the line are intermittently producing hail up to the size of loonies and locally heavy downpours.###Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes.Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. À 15h47 HAR, les météorologues d’Environnement Canada surveillent une ligne d'orages violents pouvant produire des rafales fortes, de la grêle de la taille d’une pièce de cinq cents à une balle de ping-pong et de la pluie forte.Cette ligne d'orages est quasi stationnaire depuis les secteurs près d'Edmonton sud-ouest jusqu'à près de Rich Lake.

Les cellules individuelles dans la ligne produisent par moments des grêlons atteignant jusqu'à la taille d'une pièce d'un dollar, ainsi que des pluies torrentielles par endroits.###N'oubliez pas que les orages violents peuvent produire des tornades.Une alerte d'orages violents est émise lorsqu'il y a ou qu'il y aura des orages qui s'accompagnent ou qui s'accompagneront probablement d'au moins un des éléments suivants : grosse grêle, vents destructeurs ou pluies torrentielles.
item.dc:creator: cap-pac@canada.ca

item.title: severe thunderstorm watch in effect veille d'orages violents en vigueur
item.description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing damaging wind gusts, damaging hail and torrential rain.###Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads.Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to storm.ontario@ec.gc.ca or tweet reports to #ONStorm.For more information:http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html. Les conditions sont propices à la formation d'orages dangereux pouvant produire des rafales causant des dommages, de la grêle causant des dommages et de la pluie torrentielle.###De très fortes rafales peuvent endommager des bâtiments, déraciner des arbres et emporter de gros véhicules hors de la route. N'oubliez pas que les orages violents peuvent produire des tornades. Les pluies torrentielles peuvent causer des crues soudaines et une accumulation d'eau sur les routes.Une veille d'orages violents est émise lorsque les conditions atmosphériques sont propices à la formation d'orages qui pourraient s'accompagner d'au moins un des éléments suivants : grosse grêle, vents destructeurs ou pluies torrentielles.Veuillez continuer à surveiller les alertes et les prévisions émises par Environnement Canada. Pour signaler du temps violent, envoyez un courriel à storm.ontario@ec.gc.ca ou publiez un gazouillis avec le mot-clic #ONMétéo.Pour obtenir plus de renseignements :http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/french/beprepared/beprepared_fr.html.
item.dc:creator: cap-pac@canada.ca

item.title: special weather statement in effect bulletin météorologique spécial en vigueur
item.description: An unstable air mass combined with abundant moisture will fuel thunderstorms over BC Peace region this afternoon and evening. Some of the thunderstorms may generate heavy downpour with local rainfall of over 20 mm/hour. Local flooding is possible.###Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to pacificstorm@ec.gc.ca or tweet reports to #BCStorm. Une masse d'air instable combinée à beaucoup d'humidité occasionnera la formation d'orages sur la région de Peace en Colombie-Britannique cet après-midi et ce soir. Certains de ces orages pourraient générer des pluies torrentielles, soit une accumulation de pluie de plus de 20 mm par heure par endroits. Des inondations sont possibles par endroits.###Veuillez continuer à surveiller les alertes et les prévisions émises par Environnement Canada. Pour signaler du temps violent, envoyez un courriel à pacificstorm@ec.gc.ca ou publiez un gazouillis avec le mot-clic #BCMétéo.
item.dc:creator: cap-pac@canada.ca

item.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS CURRENTLY MOVING THROUGH THE HARRISBURGAREA TO AFFECT THE DELAWARE VALLEY LATER THIS AFTERNOON...AT 125 PM EDT...A LINE OF STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WAS MOVING THROUGHTHE HARRISBURG AREA. IF THEY MAINTAIN THEIR CURRENT SPEED, THEY`LLMOVE ACROSS BERKS COUNTY BETWEEN 230 AND 330 PM, THE LEHIGH VALLEYBETWEEN 300 AND 400 PM, AND MAKE IT INTO THE DELAWARE VALLEY AROUND530 OR 600 PM.WIND GUSTS UP TO 50 MPH ARE POSSIBLE WITH THESE STORMS ALONG WITHCLOUD TO GROUND LIGHTNING. PONDING ACROSS LOW-LYING OR POORDRAINAGE AREAS WILL BE POSSIBLE AS THE STORMS MOVE THROUGH YOUR AREA.MONITOR LOCAL RADIO AND TV STATIONS...AS WELL AS LOCAL CABLE TVOUTLETS...FOR ADDITIONAL INFORMATION. item.title: Flood Advisory issued July 06 at 11:36AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
item.description: THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE IN FAIRBANKS HAS EXTENDED THE* FLOOD ADVISORY FOR...THE SOUTH FORK OF THE KUSKOKWIM RIVER IN NIKOLAI.* UNTIL 1245 PM AKDT THURSDAY* SEVERAL INCHES OF RAIN OVER THE ALASKA RANGE EARLIER THIS WEEK HASCAUSED THE SOUTH FORK OF THE KUSKOKWIM RIVER TO RISE OVERBANK ATNIKOLAI. THE RIVER IS EXPECTED TO GRADUALLY FALL THROUGH THURSDAY.* MINOR FLOODING OF LOW LYING AREAS AROUND NIKOLAI IS OCCURRING.RESIDENTS OF THE AREA HAVE REPORTED THAT A LOW WATER CROSSING ONTHE ROAD TO THE DUMP IS CURRENTLY UNDER WATER. SEVERAL AREASANDBARS ARE CURRENTLY UNDER WATER AND THERE IS SIGNIFICANT DEBRISFLOATING DOWN THE RIVER.
item.dc:creator: w-nws.webmaster@noaa.gov

item.title: Flood Warning issued July 01 at 9:25PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
item.description: ...A FLOOD WARNING FROM A GLACIER-DAMMED LAKE OUTBURST REMAINS INEFFECT UNTIL 815 AM AKDT SATURDAY FOR MENDENHALL RIVER IN THECENTRAL INNER CHANNELS...AT 925 PM AKDT...REPORTING GAUGES INDICATED A GLACIER-DAMMED LAKEOUTBURST ALONG THE MENDENHALL LAKE AND RIVER WILL BEGIN TO SUBSIDE.WATER FROM THE GLACIER-DAMMED LAKE INTO THE RIVER SYSTEM HAS ENDED WITHFLOOD WATERS STARTING TO RECEDE.FOR THE MENDENHALL LAKE:AT 915 PM AKDT THE STAGE WAS 11.6 FEET.FLOOD STAGE IS 9.0 FEET.FORECAST: MENDENHALL LAKE CRESTED AT 815 PM AT RECORD LEVEL OF 11.99FEET AND WILL CONTINUE TO DROP THROUGH THE NEXT 12 HOURS. WATERLEVELS WILL REMAIN ABOVE FLOOD STAGE UNTIL SATURDAY MORNING.IMPACTS:AT 10.0 FEET: WATER LEVELS WILL INUNDATE MENDENHALL CAMPGROUNDWITH UP TO 3 FEET OF WATER COVERING LOW AREAS ALONG WITH UP TO1.5 FEET OF WATER COVERING WEST GLACIER SPUR ROAD. PORTIONS OFWEST GLACIER TRAIL WILL BE IMPASSABLE.AT 11.0 FEET: VIEW DRIVE WILL BE FLOODED AND IMPASSABLE WITHSIGNIFICANT FLOODING TO SOME HOMES IN THE AREA.PLEASE STAY TUNED TO NOAA WEATHER RADIO OR YOUR FAVORITE LOCALWEATHER NEWS SOURCE FOR UPDATES ON THIS SITUATION.IF YOU LIVE NEAR OR ALONG THE MENDENHALL RIVER SYSTEM STAY ALERTAND BE PREPARED TO TAKE ACTION.THE COLD WATER TEMPERATURES CAN INCREASE THE THREAT OF HYPOTHERMIAAND LOWER THE TIME REQUIRED TO CAUSE HYPOTHERMIA.
item.dc:creator: w-nws.webmaster@noaa.gov

item.title: Flood Warning issued July 01 at 12:30PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
item.description: ...A FLOOD WARNING FROM A GLACIER-DAMMED LAKE OUTBURST REMAINS INEFFECT UNTIL 815 AM AKDT SATURDAY FOR MENDENHALL RIVER IN THECENTRAL INNER CHANNELS...AT 1230 AM AKDT...REPORTING GAUGES CONTINUE TO INDICATE A GLACIER-DAMMED LAKEOUTBURST FLOOD ALONG THE MENDENHALL RIVER. THE ADDED WATERFROM THE GLACIER-DAMMED LAKE INTO THE RIVER SYSTEM WILL RESULT INCONTINUED FLOODING. THE RIVER IS CURRENTLY RISING AT 3 INCHESPER HOUR. ESTIMATED SUICIDE BASIN LAKE VOLUME PRIOR TO RELEASEINDICATES THAT MENDENHALL LAKE AND RIVER COULD SEE SIMILAR LEVELSTO THE 2014 RECORD EVENT OF 11.85 FEET. THE CURRENT DATA INDICATES THAT THERIVER MAY CREST SLIGHTLY HIGHER AND SOONER THAN PREVIOUSLY FORECAST.AS OF 1000 AM AKDT WATER WAS COVERING WEST GLACIER SPUR ROAD BETWEENSKATERS CABIN AND WEST GLACIER TRAIL. WATER WAS ALSO UP INTO BACKYARDSOF SOME HOUSES ALONG VIEW DRIVE. PEOPLE ARE ENCOURAGED TO STAY AWAY FROMFLOOD PRONE AREAS. EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT REQUESTS THE PUBLIC TO AVOID STANDINGON BACK LOOP BRIDGE.FOR THE MENDENHALL RIVER:AT 1230 AM AKDT THE STAGE WAS 10.0 FEET.FLOOD STAGE IS 9.0 FEET.FORECAST: AROUND 12.0 FEET BETWEEN 4 AND 8 PM ON JULY 1. THIS STAGEIS JUST ABOVE THE RECORD CREST OF 11.85 FEET SET IN JULY OF 2014.INHERENT UNCERTAINTY IN INTIAL GLACIAL LAKE VOLUME WILL RESULT INVARYING CREST HEIGHT AND TIMING.IMPACTS:AT 10.0 FEET: WATER LEVELS WILL INUNDATE MENDENHALL CAMPGROUND WITHUP TO 3 FEET OF WATER COVERING LOW AREAS ALONG WITH UP TO 1.5 FEETOF WATER COVERING WEST GLACIER SPUR ROAD. PORTIONS OF WEST GLACIERTRAIL WILL BE IMPASSABLE.AT 11.0 FEET: VIEW DRIVE WILL BE FLOODED AND IMPASSABLE WITHSIGNIFICANT FLOODING TO SOME HOMES IN THE AREA.PLEASE STAY TUNED TO NOAA WEATHER RADIO OR YOUR FAVORITE LOCALWEATHER NEWS SOURCE FOR UPDATES ON THIS SITUATION.IF YOU LIVE NEAR OR ALONG MENDENHALL RIVER SYSTEM STAY ALERTAND BE PREPARED TO TAKE ACTION.THE COLD WATER TEMPERATURES CAN INCREASE THE THREAT OF HYPOTHERMIAAND LOWER THE TIME REQUIRED TO CAUSE HYPOTHERMIA.
item.dc:creator: w-nws.webmaster@noaa.gov

item.description: ...The National Weather Service in Grand Junction CO has issued aflood advisory for the Roaring Fork River...Roaring Fork River near Aspen affecting Pitkin County.Above average temperatures will lead to continued snowmelt fromthe high mountains over the next several days. River flows willcontinue to remain high from the snowmelt and from diversionmanagement upstream.The National Weather Service in Grand Junction CO has issued a* Flood Advisory forThe Roaring Fork River near Aspen.* until Monday afternoon.* At 09 AM Saturday the stage was 3.8 feet.* Bankfull stage is 4.0 feet.* Flood stage is 5.0 feet.* Forecast...The river will rise to near 4.1 feet by midnightSunday and again at around midnight Monday.* Impact...At 5.0 feet...Flooding of lowland areas adjacent to theriver can be expected in Aspen.

item.title: Flood Warning issued June 17 at 9:14AM CDT until further notice by NWS NorthPlatte
item.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers inNebraska...North Platte River at Lewellen affecting Garden and KeithCounties.North Platte River near North Platte affecting Lincoln County..Minor flooding continues along the North Platte River upstream ofLake McConaughy near Lewellen. Moderate flooding continues nearNorth Platte and toward the confluence with the Platte River justeast of the city. Flooding is a result of increased releases fromreservoirs in Wyoming...as well as increased releases from LakeMcConaughy. Flooding is expected to continue through June.The Flood Warning continues forThe North Platte River at Lewellen.* until further notice.* At 7:45 AM Friday the stage was 8.0 feet.* Flood stage is 7.5 feet.* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.* Forecast...The river will hold steady around 8.0 feet.* Impact...At 8.5 feet...Moderate flood stage. Flooding aroundFairground Street, County Road 46, County Road 199 A and CountyRoad 44 A east of Highway 26. Homes near and along the river maybegin to flood.&&

item.title: Flood Warning issued June 12 at 8:45PM CDT until further notice by NWS Lake Charles
item.description: ...The flood warning continues for the following rivers inLouisiana...Texas...Sabine River Near Deweyville...The flood warning continues for the following rivers in Texas..Neches River Near Town BluffNeches River Near EvadaleNeches River Near BeaumontPine Island Bayou Near Sour LakeThe Flood Warning continues forThe Neches River Near Evadale.* until further notice...or until the warning is cancelled.* At 8:00 PM Sunday the stage was 17.1 feet.* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.* Flood stage is 17.0 feet.* Forecast...The river will continue rising to near 17.2 feet bytomorrow evening then begin falling.* Impact...At stages near 17.0 feet...Minor flooding expected withthe boat ramps at Evadale possibly becoming inaccessible. Floodingcan be expected in the low-lying areas of the Lakeview community inOrange County.&&

item.title: Flood Warning issued June 13 at 2:04AM CDT until June 14 at 9:32PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
item.description: The Flood Warning continues forThe Washita River near Dickson.* from early this morning to Tuesday evening...or until the warningis cancelled.* At 1:30 AM Monday the stage was 21.2 feet.* Major flooding is forecast.* Flood stage is 27.0 feet.* Forecast...The Washita River will rise above flood stage earlyMonday morning and crest near 34.0 feet Monday evening. The WashitaRiver will fall below flood stage late Tuesday afternoon.* Impact...At 34.0 feet...Flood depths up to 9 feet extend damagesalong the Washita River valley...from near Davis in MurrayCounty...to near Dickson in Carter County...to the headwaters ofLake Texoma in Johnston County. Many homesteads could be flooded orisolated. About 7 thousand acres of agricultural lands are covered.Any flooding on tributary creeks is increased by backwater from theriver.&&
item.dc:creator: w-nws.webmaster@noaa.gov

item.title: Flood Warning issued June 12 at 9:39PM CDT until further notice by NWS Houston - Galveston
item.description: A river flood warning remains in effect for the Trinity River.The Flood Warning continues forThe Trinity River In Liberty* until further notice...or until the warning is canceled.* At 0815 PM Sunday the stage was 27.7 feet.* Moderate flooding is occurring and Moderate flooding is forecast.* Flood stage is 26.0 feet.* Forecast...The river will hold steady then rise very slowly Tuesday and Wednesday.* At 29.0 feet...Major lowland flooding begins as homes in several subdivisionsabove Liberty begin flooding. Extensive flooding over much of Liberty Countycan be expected with each incremental rise in the river.&&&&Flood Observed Forecast 6 PMLocation Stage Stage Day Time Mon Tue Wed ThuTrinity RiverLiberty 26 27.7 Sun 08 PM 27.7 27.8 28.0 28.1

item.title: Flood Advisory issued June 09 at 9:46PM CDT until June 10 at 9:17AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
item.description: THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE IN LEAGUE CITY HAS EXTENDED THE* FLOOD ADVISORY FOR...CENTRAL BRAZORIA COUNTY IN SOUTHEASTERN TEXAS...* UNTIL 1045 PM CDT SATURDAY* AT 942 PM CDT...EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT REPORTS ONGOING RIVERFLOODING FROM THE BRAZOS RIVER AND OYSTER CREEK.* RIVER FLOODING CONTINUES ALONG PORTIONS OF THE LOWER BRAZOS RIVERIN BRAZORIA COUNTY. AS ADDITIONAL WATER MOVES DOWN THE RIVER...THERE IS THE POTENTIAL FOR INUNDATION FOR ALL AREAS BETWEEN THEBRAZOS RIVER AND OYSTER CREEK. FLOOD WATERS ARE RECEDING BUT WILLSTILL TAKE MORE TIME. DUE TO FLAT TERRAIN... FLOOD WATERS MAY BESLOW TO RECEDE AND MAY NEED TO BE PUMPED OUT OF SHELTERED AREASTHAT INHIBIT DRAINING OR EVAPORATION.* RESIDENTS ARE URGED TO FOLLOW THE DIRECTION OF LOCAL OFFICIALS ANDEVACUATE IF PLACED UNDER A MANDATORY EVACUATION.* ADDITIONALLY... MANY ROADS REMAIN IMPASSIBLE ACROSS THE ADVISORYAREA AND MOTORISTS SHOULD NOT ATTEMPT TRAVEL ACROSS FLOODEDROADWAYS. CURRENT ROAD CONDITIONS ARE AVAILABLE THROUGH THE TEXASDEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION.* SOME LOCATIONS THAT WILL EXPERIENCE FLOODING INCLUDE...LAKE JACKSON...WESTERN ANGLETON...FREEPORT...CLUTE...RICHWOOD...JONESCREEK...OYSTER CREEK...HOLIDAY LAKES...BAILEY`S PRAIRIE AND BONNEY.
item.dc:creator: w-nws.webmaster@noaa.gov

item.title: severe thunderstorm warning in effect alerte d'orages violents en vigueur
item.description: At 6:50 p.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to ping pong ball size hail and heavy rain.This thunderstorm is 30 km east of Pipestone and is tracking southeast at 40 km/h towards Hartney and Lauder.Storm spotters have reported twoonie size hail in Pipestone. À 18h50 HAC, les météorologues d'Environnement Canada surveillent un orage violent pouvant produire des rafales très fortes, de la grêle pouvant atteindre la taille d'une balle de ping-pong et de la pluie forte.Cet orage se trouve à 30 km à l'est de Pipestone et déplace vers le sud-est à 40 km/h en direction de Hartney et et de Lauder.Des observateurs ont signalé des grêlons de la taille d'une pièce de deux dollars à Pipestone.
item.dc:creator: cap-pac@ec.gc.ca

item.title: Flood Warning issued June 05 at 12:23PM EDT until June 07 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Mobile
item.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a flood warning for thefollowing rivers in Florida...Shoal River Near Crestview affecting Okaloosa County..Heavy rainfall is forecast to occur over the next 24 hours. As a result...riverlevels are forecast to rise and a flood warning is now in effect. It isemphasized that the following forecast is based on the expected rainfall duringthe next 24 hours. If less rainfall occurs...it may be necessary to revise thisstage forecast downward.SAFETY MESSAGE...Stay tuned to developments by listening to NOAA Weather radio.&&The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a* Flood Warning forThe Shoal River Near Crestview* From Monday morning until Tuesday afternoon* At 10AM Sunday the stage was...7.1 feet.* Minor flooding is forecast* Flood stage is 8 feet.* Forecast to rise above flood stage by tomorrow morning and continue to risenear 8.1 feet by early Tuesday morning. The river will fall below flood stageby Tuesday afternoon.* At 8 feet...Minor flooding of low lying areas will occur.&&

item.title: Flood Warning issued June 05 at 9:44AM CDT until further notice by NWS Corpus Christi
item.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...San Antonio River At Goliad affecting Calhoun...Goliad...Refugio andVictoria Counties...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas..Guadalupe River At Victoria affecting Victoria CountyGuadalupe River Near Bloomington affecting Calhoun...Refugio andVictoria Counties.Recent rainfall over the area will keep the aforementionedrivers above flood stage for the next few days.The Flood Warning continues forthe Guadalupe River Near Bloomington.* until further notice...or until the warning is cancelled.* At 9:00 AM Sunday the stage was 26.6 feet.* Moderate flooding is occurring and Moderate flooding is forecast.* Flood stage is 20.0 feet.* Forecast: The river will continue rising to near 26.8 feet Tuesdayearly afternoon, hold for about 24 hours, then begin slowly fallingby Wednesday.* At 27.0 feet Major flooding occurs. Flow downstream near Highway 35is several hundred yards wide, cutting off many of the lowest homes.Livestock are cut off and could drown. Pumps, tank batteries, and anyequipment in the flood plain below Victoria are flooded. Thecampground near Tivoli below Highway 35 and residences just aboveHighway 35 are flooded.&&Below are the latest river stages and stage forecasts:FLD LATEST FORECAST 6 AM LSTLOCATION STG STG DAY TIME Mon Tue Wed Thu FriGuadalupe RiverBloomington 20 26.6 Sun 09 AM 26.8 26.8 26.6 26.4 26.1&&

item.title: Flood Watch issued June 05 at 7:58AM PDT until June 08 at 11:24PM PDT by NWS Spokane
item.description: ...THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE IN SPOKANE, WA HAS ISSUED A FLOODWATCH FOR THE FOLLOWING RIVERS AND LAKES IN WASHINGTON...STEHEKIN RIVER AT STEHEKIN AFFECTING CHELAN COUNTYA prolonged period of unseasonably warm temperatures through Tuesdaywill result in significant snow melt in the Cascades. This mayresult in the Stehekin River reaching flood stage as early as Mondayevening.MONITOR CURRENT WATER LEVELS ON THE WEB AT:HTTP://WATER.WEATHER.GOV/AHPS2/INDEX.PHP?WFO=OTXHERE ARE SOME FORECASTS FOR AREA RIVERS AND LAKES:THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE IN SPOKANE, WA HAS ISSUED A* FLOOD WATCH FORTHE STEHEKIN RIVER AT STEHEKIN* FROM MONDAY EVENING TO WEDNESDAY EVENING.* AT 7:30 AM SUNDAY THE STAGE WAS 22.5 FEET.* MINOR FLOODING IS POSSIBLE.* FLOOD STAGE IS 24.00 FEET.* FORECAST...THE RIVER IS FORECAST TO SLOWLY RECEDE THROUGH EARLYTHIS AFTERNOON. THE RIVER WILL THEN RISE SHARPLY TO NEAR 23.7 FEETTHIS EVENING. AN ADDITIONAL RISE TO NEAR 24.4 FEET IS POSSIBLEMONDAY EVENING. THE RIVER IS FORECAST TO DROP TO BELOW FLOOD STAGEBY LATE WEDNESDAY AS COOLER TEMPERATURES SLOW THE MOUNTAIN SNOW MELT.&&* AT 24.0 FEET...THE RIVER MAY BE OUT OF ITS BANKS IN SPOTS AND ONTOTHE STEHEKIN VALLEY ROAD AND COMPANY CREEK ROAD.* AT 23.8 FEET...MCGREGOR`S MEADOW ROAD WILL BE MOSTLY FLOODED.* AT 23.5 FEET...SOME WATER MAY BE OVER MCGREGOR MEADOWS ROAD AND THEDRIVE THROUGH THE TOLLBER PASTURE. PART OF THE HARLEQUIN CAMPGROUNDMAY BE FLOODED.
item.dc:creator: w-nws.webmaster@noaa.gov

item.description: THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE IN SAN ANGELO HAS ISSUED A* URBAN AND SMALL STREAM FLOOD ADVISORY FOR...NORTHEASTERN TAYLOR COUNTY IN WEST CENTRAL TEXAS...* UNTIL 830 PM CDT* AT 636 PM CDT...DOPPLER RADAR INDICATED HEAVY RAIN DUE TOTHUNDERSTORMS. item.title: Flood Warning issued June 04 at 4:02PM CDT until June 05 at 7:46PM CDT by NWS Springfield
item.description: THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE IN SPRINGFIELD HAS ISSUED A* FLOOD WARNING FOR...SHANNON COUNTY IN SOUTH CENTRAL MISSOURI...EASTERN TANEY COUNTY IN SOUTHWESTERN MISSOURI...HOWELL COUNTY IN SOUTH CENTRAL MISSOURI...TEXAS COUNTY IN SOUTH CENTRAL MISSOURI...DOUGLAS COUNTY IN SOUTHWESTERN MISSOURI...OZARK COUNTY IN SOUTHWESTERN MISSOURI...* UNTIL 1000 AM CDT SUNDAY* AT 358 PM CDT...THE DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION REPORTED FLOODINGIN THE WARNED AREA. 1 TO 3 INCHES OF RAIN FELL EARLIER TODAYACROSS THE WARNED AREA. WHILE HEAVY RAINFALL HAS ENDED...CREEKSAND STREAMS WILL CONTINUE TO SLOWLY RISE DUE TO THIS RAINFALL.* CREEKS...STREAMS...AND LOW WATER CROSSINGS WILL BE ESPECIALLYSUSCEPTIBLE TO THE DANGERS OF FLOODING.LOCATIONS IN THE WARNING INCLUDE...WEST PLAINS... CURRENT RIVER STATE PARK...AVA... MOUNTAIN VIEW...WILLOW SPRINGS... CABOOL...HOUSTON... WINONA...GAINESVILLE... BIRCH TREE...EMINENCE... POMONA...SUMMERSVILLE... RAYMONDVILLE...BAKERSFIELD... THEODOSIA...SOUTH FORK... PONTIAC...BRANDSVILLE... WASOLA...THIS WARNING INCLUDES BUT IS NOT LIMITED TO THE FOLLOWING LOW WATERCROSSINGS...ROUTE FF AT HUNTER CREEK EAST OF AVA...ROUTE H...3 MILES EAST OF WINONA...ROUTE FF AT TURKEY CREEK EAST OF AVA...HIGHWAY 142 AT THE SPRING RIVER WEST OF LANTON...AND HIGHWAY 142 AT THE BENNETTS RIVER WEST OF MOODY.
item.dc:creator: w-nws.webmaster@noaa.gov

item.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 7:52PM EDT until June 05 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
item.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL AFFECT NORTHEASTERN BRACKEN...NORTHWESTERN MASON...NORTHERN ADAMS AND SOUTHERN BROWN COUNTIES UNTIL815 PM EDT...AT 752 PM EDT...RADAR INDICATED A STRONG THUNDERSTORM NEARGEORGETOWN...MOVING NORTHEAST AT 50 MPH.STORM HAZARDS INCLUDE...WINDS TO 50 MPH...VERY HEAVY RAIN...LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE...GEORGETOWN...WEST UNION...PEEBLES...RIPLEY...WINCHESTER...SEAMAN...EMERALD...DECATUR...RUSSELLVILLE...DOVER...HIGGINSPORT...CHERRY FORK...MAY HILL...STATE ROUTE 32 AT US ROUTE 62...LOCUST GROVE...LAKE WAYNOKA...REDOAK...DUNKINSVILLE...FINCASTLE AND SERPENT MOUND.WATER WILL POND ON ROADS AND MAY QUICKLY FILL ROADSIDE DITCHES ANDSMALL STREAMS.RESIDENTS IN THESE AREAS SHOULD REMAIN ALERT. IF THIS STORM BECOMESSTRONGER...THEN A WARNING MAY BE NEEDED.TO REPORT HAZARDOUS WEATHER CONDITIONS...GO TO OUR WEBSITE ATWEATHER.GOV/ILN AND SUBMIT YOUR REPORT VIA SOCIAL MEDIA...WHEN YOUCAN DO SO SAFELY.
item.dc:creator: w-nws.webmaster@noaa.gov

item.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 4:27PM EDT until June 05 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Charleston
item.description: AT 426 PM EDT...A LINE OF STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WAS ALONG A LINEEXTENDING FROM NEAR VANCEBURG TO NEAR HODE...AND MOVING NORTHEAST AT45 MPH.WINDS IN EXCESS OF 30 MPH AND PEA SIZE HAIL ARE POSSIBLE WITH THESESTORMS.LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE...CHARLESTON...HUNTINGTON...ASHLAND...PORTSMOUTH...IRONTON...NITRO...JACKSON...GRAYSON...GALLIPOLIS...MADISON...LOUISA...WINFIELD...COAL GROVE...LOGAN...OLIVE HILL...OAK HILL...WAYNE...HAMLIN...RIO GRANDE AND PROCTORVILLE.THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS...INTERSTATE 79 NEAR MILE MARKER 1.INTERSTATE 77 IN WEST VIRGINIA BETWEEN MILE MARKERS 96 AND 106.INTERSTATE 64 IN KENTUCKY BETWEEN MILE MARKERS 150 AND 191.INTERSTATE 64 IN WEST VIRGINIA BETWEEN MILE MARKERS 1 AND 57.WEST VIRGINIA TURNPIKE BETWEEN MILE MARKERS 68 AND 95.ROUTE 119 BETWEEN MILE MARKERS 27 AND 80.TORRENTIAL RAINFALL IS ALSO OCCURRING WITH THESE STORMS...AND MAYCAUSE LOCALIZED FLOODING. DO NOT DRIVE YOUR VEHICLE THROUGH FLOODEDROADWAYS.EXCESSIVE RUNOFF FROM HEAVY RAINFALL WILL CAUSE ELEVATED LEVELS ONSMALL CREEKS AND STREAMS...AND PONDING OF WATER IN URBAN AREAS...HIGHWAYS...STREETS AND UNDERPASSES...AS WELL AS OTHER POOR DRAINAGEAREAS AND LOW LYING SPOTS.EXCESSIVE RUNOFF FROM HEAVY RAINFALL WILL CAUSE ELEVATED LEVELS ONSMALL CREEKS AND STREAMS...AND PONDING OF WATER ON COUNTRY ROADS ANDFARMLAND ALONG THE BANKS OF CREEKS AND STREAMS.

item.title: Flood Warning issued June 04 at 10:20AM CDT until further notice by NWS Corpus Christi
item.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas..Guadalupe River At Victoria affecting Victoria CountyGuadalupe River Near Bloomington affecting Calhoun...Refugio andVictoria Counties.Recent rainfall over the area will keep the aforementionedrivers above flood stage for the next few days.The Flood Warning continues for the Guadalupe River At Victoria.* until further notice...or until the warning is cancelled.* At 9:15 AM Saturday the stage was 28.0 feet.* Moderate flooding is occurring and Moderate flooding is forecast.* Flood stage is 21.0 feet.* Forecast: The river will continue rising to near 28.2 feet earlyMonday morning.* At 28.0 feet Water flows into Saxet Lake Park starting to coverFordyce Road, with portions of park inaccessible. Water crossesFordyce Road at the large culvert between the lakes and main portionof Sexet Lake Park, covering some of the picnic area and roads. Watermay be flowing under the US Business 59 East and West Relief Bridges.Water is on John F. Lee Drive in Riverside Park. On McCright Drive,water approaches the first parking lot, the field across the TexasZoo, with baseball fields and stadium inaccessible .&&Below are the latest river stages and stage forecasts:FLD LATEST FORECAST 6 AM LSTLOCATION STG STG DAY TIME Sun Mon Tue Wed ThuGuadalupe RiverVictoria 21 28.0 Sat 09 AM 28.2 28.2 27.4 25.8 24.1&&

item.title: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 12:31AM CDT until June 06 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
item.description: THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE IN FORT WORTH HAS ISSUED A* FLOOD ADVISORY FOR MINOR FLOODING IN POOR DRAINAGE AREAS FOR...WESTERN EASTLAND COUNTY IN NORTH CENTRAL TEXAS...* UNTIL 330 AM CDT* AT 1230 AM CDT...DOPPLER RADAR INDICATED THUNDERSTORMS THAT WEREPRODUCING HEAVY RAINFALL ACROSS WESTERN PORTIONS OF THE COUNTY.EXCESSIVE RUNOFF FROM THESE THUNDERSTORMS WILL CAUSE MINORFLOODING. AREAS THAT ARE LOW LYING OR USUALLY EXPERIENCE POORDRAINAGE ARE MOST LIKELY TO EXPERIENCE FLOODING. THIS MEANS SOMELOW WATER CROSSINGS IN THE REGION MAY BECOME IMPASSABLE. UP TO 2INCHES OF RAIN HAS ALREADY FALLEN.ADDITIONAL RAINFALL OF UP TO AN INCH IS EXPECTED OVER THE AREA. THISADDITIONAL RAIN WILL MAKE MINOR FLOODING.
item.dc:creator: w-nws.webmaster@noaa.gov

item.description: ...AN AREA OF STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL AFFECT PRINCE EDWARDCOUNTY...AT 756 PM EDT...RADAR INDICATED STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WERE LOCATEDALONG A LINE EXTENDING FROM NEAR FARMVILLE TO PROSPECT TO PAMPLINCITY. MOVEMENT WAS SOUTHEAST AT 30 MPH.WIND GUSTS IN EXCESS OF 30 MPH AND PEA TO NICKLE SIZE HAIL AREPOSSIBLE WITH THESE STORMS.LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE...FARMVILLE...HAMPDEN SYDNEY COLLEGE...LONGWOOD UNIVERSITY...HAMPDENSYDNEY...PROSPECT...DARLINGTON HEIGHTS...BRIERY CREEK LAKE...ALLENS MILL...ELAM...TUGGLE...KINGSVILLE AND WORSHAM.MOTORISTS SHOULD USE EXTRA CAUTION IN THE VICINITY OF THESE STORMS.BE PREPARED FOR RAPID CHANGES IN WEATHER AND ROAD CONDITIONS. HEAVYRAIN COULD CAUSE PONDING OF WATER ON ROADS...AND POSSIBLE MINORFLOODING OF DITCHES AND POOR DRAINAGE AREAS.FREQUENT CLOUD TO GROUND LIGHTNING IS OCCURRING WITH THESE STORMS.LIGHTNING CAN STRIKE MORE THAN 10 MILES AWAY FROM A THUNDERSTORM.SEEK A SAFE SHELTER INSIDE A BUILDING OR VEHICLE.
item.dc:creator: w-nws.webmaster@noaa.gov

item.title: Flood Warning issued June 02 at 10:21AM CDT until further notice by NWS Cheyenne
item.description: * Flood Warning continues forThe North Platte River near Mitchell.* For the North Platte River near Mitchell, Minor flooding isoccurring, with a stage of 8.4 feet measured at 9 AM Thursday.* Moderate flooding is forecast, with a maximum stage of 8.5 feet,which is 1.0 feet above flood stage.* The river is forecast to decline to around 8.1 feet Friday morning.* Impact...at 8.5 feet...Monument Pathway in Scottsbluff is under fourto five feet of water along low lying areas. Low lying areaflooding intensifies and becomes more widespread at Riverside Parkin Scottsbluff. Homes along the North Platte River from Mitchell toScottsbluff are totally inundated with basement and overlandflooding. Flooding of low lying agricultural land near the rivercontinues to intensify and becomes more widespread.* Flood history...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.5 feeton May 26 1973.&&
item.dc:creator: w-nws.webmaster@noaa.gov

ANTHONY. MOVEMENT WASEAST AT 25 MPH.HALF INCH HAIL AND WIND GUSTS TO 50 MPH WILL BE POSSIBLE WITH THESESTORMS.LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE...BISMARCK...MANDAN...BEULAH...GARRISON...WASHBURN...GLEN ULLIN...HAZEN...LINCOLN...NEW SALEM...UNDERWOOD...WILTON...TURTLE LAKE...CENTER...MAX...ZAP...FLASHER...RIVERDALE AND GOLDEN VALLEY.VERY HEAVY RAINFALL IS ALSO OCCURRING WITH THESE STORMS...AND MAYLEAD TO LOCALIZED FLOODING. DO NOT DRIVE YOUR VEHICLE THROUGHFLOODED ROADWAYS.FREQUENT CLOUD TO GROUND LIGHTNING IS OCCURRING WITH THESE STORMS.LIGHTNING CAN STRIKE 10 MILES AWAY FROM A THUNDERSTORM. SEEK SHELTERINSIDE A BUILDING OR VEHICLE.&&A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT/1100PM MDT/ FOR SOUTH CENTRAL NORTH DAKOTA.

item.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 8:01PM EDT until June 02 at 10:45PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
item.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WITH HEAVY WILL AFFECT ...AT 759 PM EDT...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WAS NEAR PERRY STATE FOREST...MOVING SOUTHEAST AT 10 MPH.LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE...GRATIOT...FULTONHAM AND EAST FULTONHAM.TORRENTIAL RAINFALL IS ALSO OCCURRING WITH THIS STORM...AND MAY CAUSELOCALIZED FLOODING. DO NOT DRIVE YOUR VEHICLE THROUGH FLOODEDROADWAYS.EXCESSIVE RUNOFF FROM HEAVY RAINFALL WILL CAUSE ELEVATED LEVELS ONSMALL CREEKS AND STREAMS...AND PONDING OF WATER ON COUNTRY ROADS ANDFARMLAND ALONG THE BANKS OF CREEKS AND STREAMS.IN HILLY TERRAIN THERE ARE HUNDREDS OF LOW WATER CROSSINGS WHICH AREPOTENTIALLY DANGEROUS IN HEAVY RAIN. DO NOT ATTEMPT TO TRAVEL ACROSSFLOODED ROADS. FIND ALTERNATE ROUTES. IT TAKES ONLY A FEW INCHES OFSWIFTLY FLOWING WATER TO CARRY VEHICLES AWAY.
item.dc:creator: w-nws.webmaster@noaa.gov

item.title: Flood Warning issued June 02 at 6:07PM CDT until June 05 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
item.description: ...The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a FloodWarning for the following rivers in Texas...Pecan Bayou At Brownwood affecting Brown CountyRecent rainfall as much as 3 inches downstream of Lake Brownwood willlikely cause a rise above flood stage on the Pecan Bayou at Brownwood.The river level is river is forecast to rise above flood stage laterthis evening, and to crest at 15.3 feet from 1 PM to 7 PM Friday. Theriver is forecast to drop just below flood stage late Saturday night.Additional rainfall is in the forecast tonight into Friday. Be sureto keep up with the latest weather conditions and flood information.The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a* Flood Warning forThe Pecan Bayou At Brownwood.* until Sunday evening...Or until the warning is cancelled.* Flood stage is 15.0 feet.* Forecast...The river is forecast to have a maximum value of 15.3feet tomorrow early afternoon.* Impact...At 15.0 feet...Minor flooding will occur along Pecan Bayou.Minor flooding of the City Park will occur.* Flood history...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.2 feeton Oct 13 1931.&&
item.dc:creator: w-nws.webmaster@noaa.gov

The river should fall below flood stage by Saturday aftermidnight.* At 17 feet, Moderate out of bank flooding will occur. A few ruralroads closures will be needed along the river reach. Moderateflooding will occur along the river through Greenville.&&

item.title: Flood Warning issued June 02 at 8:44AM CDT until June 06 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
item.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers inNebraska...North Platte River near Lisco affecting Garden County.North Platte River at Lewellen affecting Garden and KeithCounties.North Platte River near North Platte affecting Lincoln County.Platte River at Brady North Channel affecting Lincoln County..Minor to moderate flooding will continue along the North PlatteRiver...both upstream and downstream of Lake McConaughy. The floodingis due to increased releases from reservoirs in Wyoming and from LakeMcConaughy itself. The combined flow from the North Platte River andthe South Platte River...will continue to produce minor flooding onthe Platte River near Brady.The Flood Warning continues forThe North Platte River near Lisco.* until further notice.* At 7:45 AM Thursday the stage was 4.2 feet.* Flood stage is 4.0 feet.* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.* Forecast...The river will continue minor fluctuations near 4.3feet. The river will then begin to slowly fall over the weekend.* Impact...At 4.0 feet...Minor flood stage. Minor flooding withsubstantial low lying areas flooded along the south side of theriver. Flooding begins along the north side of the river.&&

item.description: * Flood Warning continues forThe Laramie River at Laramie.* For the Laramie River at Laramie, Minor flooding is occurring, witha stage of 8.2 feet measured at 10 AM Wednesday.* Minor flooding is forecast, with a stage of 8.8 feet expected earlynext week, which is 0.8 feet above flood stage.* Impact...at 9.0 feet...Water overflows the greenway at Spruce andPark Streets. Homes next to the greenway along the right river bankexperience moderate flooding. Water begins to encroach the mobilehome park along the south end of McCue Street along the left riverbank. Water is bankfull behind trailer homes within the Lee TrailerCourt located just north of Curtis Street. Optimist Park south ofGarfield Street begins to flood.* Flood history...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.8 feeton Jun 14 2015.&&

item.title: Flood Warning issued June 01 at 8:44AM CDT until June 05 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
item.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...Pecan Bayou At Brownwood affecting Brown CountyAdditional runoff from rainfall Tuesady afternoon through today is expected to createa second rise along the pecan bayou through Brown County tonight. Although LakeBrownwood crested on Tuesday, a secondary rise tonight will cause the lake torise again to the same crest from Tuesday of around 1429.8 feet tonight. This will keepthe Pecan Bayou through the city of Brownwood at a level of around 15.0 to 15.2 feetthrough the rest of the week into Saturday. Many roads will continue to be closeddue to flooding in and around the Pecan Bayou.The Flood Warning continues forThe Pecan Bayou At Brownwood.* until late Saturday night.* Flood stage is 15.0 feet.* Forecast...The river is forecast to have a maximum value of 15.2feet this afternoon.* Impact...At 15.0 feet...Minor flooding will occur along Pecan Bayou.Minor flooding of the City Park and business parking lots in Brownwood will occur.&&
item.dc:creator: w-nws.webmaster@noaa.gov

item.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...Guadalupe River At Victoria affecting Victoria CountyGuadalupe River Near Bloomington affecting Calhoun...Refugio andVictoria Counties.Recent rainfall over the area will keep the aforementionedrivers above flood stage for the next few days.The Flood Warning continues for the Guadalupe River Near Bloomington.* Until further notice...or until the warning is cancelled.* At 9:00 PM Tuesday the stage was 25.4 feet.* Moderate flooding is occurring and Moderate flooding is forecast.* Flood stage is 20.0 feet.* Forecast: The river will continue rising to near 26.2 feet Sundayafternoon...and remain above moderate flood stage until further notice.* At 26.0 feet Irrigation and oil well pumps, tank batteries, andequipment in the lower flood plain below Victoria flood. Livestockare cut off, may have to be fed by boat, and could drown. Homesdownstream above Highway 35 on the left bank are cut off.&&Below are the latest river stages and stage forecasts:FLD LATEST FORECAST 6 AM LSTLOCATION STG STG DAY TIME Wed Thu Fri Sat SunGuadalupe RiverBloomington 20 25.4 Tue 09 PM 25.3 25.2 25.1 25.6 26.1&&

item.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers inNebraska...North Platte River near Lisco affecting Garden County.North Platte River at Lewellen affecting Garden and KeithCounties.North Platte River near North Platte affecting Lincoln County.Platte River at Brady North Channel affecting Lincoln County..Minor to moderate flooding will continue along the North PlatteRiver...upstream and downstream of Lake McConaughy. The flooding isdue to increased releases from reservoirs in Wyoming and from LakeMcConaughy. The combined flow from the North Platte River and theSouth Platte River will continue to produce minor flooding on thePlatte River near Brady.The Flood Warning continues forThe North Platte River at Lewellen.* until further notice.* At 6:45 PM Tuesday the stage was 8.9 feet.* Flood stage is 7.5 feet.* Moderate flooding is occurring and Moderate flooding is forecast.* Forecast...The river will see minor fluctuations around 8.9 feetinto the weekend.* Impact...At 9.0 feet...Homes near and along the North Platte Riverflood, including homes along County Road 46 and County Road 199A.Flooding occurs along south side of Highway 26 from 5 milesupstream of Lewellen to Lewellen.&&

item.title: Flood Warning issued May 31 at 9:54PM CDT until further notice by NWS Houston - Galveston
item.description: A river flood warning remains in effect for Bear Creek...the BrazosRiver...the Colorado River...Cypress Creek...the Navasota River...the San Jacinto River...the Trinity River...and the West Fork of theSan Jacinto River.The Flood Warning continues forThe Brazos River In Richmond* until further notice...or until the warning is canceled.* At 0815 PM Tuesday the stage was 54.2 feet.* Record flooding is occurring and Record flooding is forecast.* Flood stage is 45.0 feet.* Forecast...At this time, a rise in the river level within majorflood levels is expected through the week with a crest rangebetween 54 and 54.5 feet. The river was rising despite incomingwater decreasing. It is believed that the water was backing upfrom construction downstream which is making the river stageforecasts more uncertain. Also of note, the gage height wasadjusted upward about 0.13 feet earlier this evening (affectingthe forecast as well).&&&&Flood Observed Forecast 6 PMLocation Stage Stage Day Time Wed Thu Fri SatBrazos RiverRichmond 45 54.2 Tue 09 PM 54.2 53.1 51.2 49.6
