item.description: THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE IN BROWNSVILLE HAS ISSUED A* SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR...NORTHWESTERN BROOKS COUNTY IN DEEP SOUTH TEXAS...* UNTIL 700 PM CDT* AT 635 PM CDT...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WAS LOCATED 9 MILES SOUTH OFRAMIREZ...OR 17 MILES SOUTHEAST OF HEBBRONVILLE...MOVING NORTHEASTAT 30 MPH.HAZARD...60 MPH WIND GUSTS AND HALF DOLLAR SIZE HAIL.SOURCE...RADAR INDICATED.IMPACT...HAIL DAMAGE TO VEHICLES...INCLUDING CRACKED WINDSHIELDSAND MINOR EXTERIOR DENTS CAN EXPECTED. SOME DAMAGE TOCROPS AND TREES IS EXPECTED. EXPECT MINOR WIND DAMAGE TOMOBILE HOMES...SOME ROOFS...SIDING AND SOME FENCES. TREELIMBS WILL BLOW DOWN AND SMALL TREES WILL BE UPROOTED.DAMAGE TO POWER LINES AND SOME POWER POLES IS EXPECTED.* THIS SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WILL REMAIN OVER MAINLY RURAL AREAS OFNORTHWESTERN BROOKS COUNTY.HAIL...1.25INWIND...60MPH
item.dc:creator: w-nws.webmaster@noaa.gov

item.description: ...SIGNIFICANT WEATHER ADVISORY FOR WESTERN WILKES COUNTY UNTIL 730PM EDT...AT 652 PM EDT...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WAS NEAR RAYLE...OR NEARWASHINGTON. LOCALIZED FLOODING INLOW LYING AND POOR DRAINAGE AREAS IS ALSO LIKELY.MOTORISTS SHOULD SLOW DOWN AND BE PREPARED FOR POSSIBLELOSS OF CONTROL DUE TO HYDROPLANING. AND FICKLIN.

item.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following areas in Texas...Cowleech Fork Sabine River At Greenville Affecting Hunt CountySouth Fork Sabine River Near Quinlan Affecting Hunt and RockwallCountiesThe Flood Warning continues forThe Cowleech Fork Sabine River At Greenville.* At 0445 PM Tuesday the stage was 7.12 feet.* Flood stage is 14 feet.* Minor flooding is forecast.* Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage byTuesday night and crest near 16 feet by Wednesday after midnight.The river should fall below flood stage by early Wednesday morning.* At 14 feet, Minor out of bank flooding will occur along the riverreach.&&

item.title: Flash Flood Warning issued May 31 at 4:07PM CDT until May 31 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
item.description: ...THE FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT FORHOOD AND SOMERVELL COUNTIES...AT 404 PM CDT...TRAINED WEATHER SPOTTERS REPORTED FLASH FLOODING INGRANBURY AND SURROUNDING AREAS. SEVERAL ROADS WERE FLOODED AND SOMEWERE IMPASSABLE. 2 TO 3 INCHES OF RAIN HAVE ALREADY FALLEN ACROSSTHE AREA THIS AFTERNOON. THE HEAVIEST RAIN HAS ENDED BUT UP TOANOTHER INCH OF RAIN IS POSSIBLE THROUGH SUNSET. WATER CONTINUES TORUN OFF AND WILL CAUSE FLASH FLOODING THROUGH 545 PM.SOME LOCATIONS THAT WILL EXPERIENCE FLOODING INCLUDE...GRANBURY...PECAN PLANTATION...GLEN ROSE...LIPAN...DINOSAUR VALLEY STATEPARK...OAK TRAIL SHORES AND TOLAR.

item.title: Flash Flood Warning issued May 31 at 3:17PM CDT until May 31 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
item.description: THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE IN FORT WORTH HAS ISSUED A* FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR...JOHNSON COUNTY IN NORTH CENTRAL TEXAS...* UNTIL 615 PM CDT* AT 316 PM CDT...DOPPLER RADAR INDICATED THUNDERSTORMS PRODUCINGVERY HEAVY RAIN NOW ENTERING WESTERN JOHNSON COUNTY. THE STORMSARE MOVING NORTHEAST AT 10 MPH AND WERE PRODUCING RAINFALL RATESOF 3 INCHES PER HOUR OR HIGHER. THIS RAINFALL WILL LEAD TOEXCESSIVE WATER RUNOFF AND CAUSE FLASH FLOODING. LOW-LYING AREASARE MOST VULNERABLE TO RAPIDLY RISING WATER. SOME LOW-WATERCROSSINGS MAY FLOOD AND BECOME IMPASSABLE.* SOME LOCATIONS THAT WILL EXPERIENCE FLOODING INCLUDE...BURLESON...CLEBURNE...KEENE...JOSHUA...GODLEY...CROSS TIMBER...CLEBURNESTATE PARK...RIO VISTA AND BRIAROAKS.
item.dc:creator: w-nws.webmaster@noaa.gov

item.title: Flood Warning issued May 31 at 12:08PM CDT until further notice by NWS NorthPlatte
item.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers inNebraska...North Platte River near Lisco affecting Garden County.North Platte River at Lewellen affecting Garden and KeithCounties.North Platte River near North Platte affecting Lincoln County.Platte River at Brady North Channel affecting Lincoln County..Minor to moderate flooding will continue along the NorthPlatte river...upstream and downstream of Lake McConaughy. Theflooding is due to increased releases from reservoirs in Wyoming andfrom Lake McConaughy. The combined flow from the North Platte riverand the South Platte river will continue to produce minor flooding onthe Platte river near Brady.The Flood Warning continues forThe North Platte River near Lisco.* until further notice.* At 11:45 AM Tuesday the stage was 4.3 feet.* Flood stage is 4.0 feet.* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.* Forecast...The river will remain near 4.3 feet.* Impact...At 4.0 feet...Minor flood stage. item.description: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR SOUTH CENTRAL KIT CARSON ANDNORTHERN CHEYENNE COUNTIES IN EAST CENTRAL COLORADO WILL EXPIRE AT545 PM MDT...THE STORM WHICH PROMPTED THE WARNING HAS WEAKENED BELOW SEVERELIMITS...AND NO LONGER POSE AN IMMEDIATE THREAT TO LIFE OR PROPERTY.THEREFORE THE WARNING WILL BE ALLOWED TO EXPIRE. THEY WILL RELAY YOUR REPORT TO THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICEGOODLAND.

item.title: rainfall warning in effect avertissement de pluie en vigueur
item.description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected.A low pressure system approaching from the south will stall over northern North Dakota overnight then gradually move eastward on Tuesday. Rain and thunderstorms ahead of this low will spread into southwestern Manitoba this evening. The heaviest rainfall potential will be overnight and Tuesday morning, however rain will persist through Tuesday night albeit with lesser amounts. Total rainfalls from this system will likely range from 35 to 75 mm in these regions.Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible.Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected.Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to storm@ec.gc.ca or tweet reports to #MBStorm. De la pluie parfois forte est prévue.Une dépression qui s'approche depuis le sud s'immobilisera sur la partie nord du Dakota du Nord au cours de la nuit, puis se déplacera graduellement vers l'est mardi. De la pluie et des orages à l'avant de cette dépression se propageront sur le sud-ouest du Manitoba ce soir. La pluie la plus forte devrait tomber au cours de la nuit et mardi matin, mais la pluie persistera jusque dans la nuit de mardi à mercredi tout en donnant des quantités moindres. La quantité totale de pluie attribuable à ce système variera probablement entre 35 et 75 mm dans ces régions.Des inondations sont possibles par endroits dans les basses terres.Un avertissement de pluie est émis lorsque l'on prévoit des quantités de pluie importantes.Veuillez continuer à surveiller les alertes et les prévisions émises par Environnement Canada. Pour signaler du temps violent, envoyez un courriel à storm@ec.gc.ca ou publiez un gazouillis avec le mot-clic #MBMétéo.
item.dc:creator: cap-pac@ec.gc.ca

item.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM MDTFOR SOUTHEASTERN PERKINS COUNTY...AT 154 PM MDT...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WAS LOCATED 8 MILES EAST OFDATE...OR 34 MILES NORTHWEST OF FAITH...MOVING EAST AT 25 MPH.HAZARD...TWO INCH HAIL.SOURCE...TRAINED WEATHER SPOTTERS REPORTED 2 INCH HAIL AT 1:45 PM 11MILES SOUTH SOUTHWEST OF BISON.IMPACT...PEOPLE AND ANIMALS OUTDOORS WILL BE INJURED. EXPECT DAMAGETO ROOFS...SIDING...WINDOWS...AND VEHICLES.LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE...CHANCE.HAIL...2.00INWIND...<50MPH
item.dc:creator: w-nws.webmaster@noaa.gov

item.title: Flood Warning issued May 30 at 9:49AM CDT until June 03 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Sioux Falls
item.description: ...The National Weather Service in Sioux Falls has issued a floodwarning for the following rivers in Iowa and South DakotaBig Sioux River At HawardenBig Sioux River At AkronOcheyedan River Near SpencerLittle Sioux River Above SpencerLittle Sioux River At Cherokee.The following river forecasts include forecast precipitation throughtonight. Any additional future rains could affect the crestforecasts.Recent rainfall has resulted in rising river levels along the Big SiouxRiver...Little Sioux River...and Ocheyedan River in southeast South Dakotaand northwest Iowa. Continued rises are expected over the next few dayswith additional rainfall forecast this afternoon and tonight.The National Weather Service in Sioux Falls has issued a* Flood Warning forThe Little Sioux River Above Spencer.* Until late Thursday night.* At 9AM Monday the stage was 10.0 feet.* Minor flooding is forecast.* Flood stage is 10.0 feet.* At stages near 10.0 feet...Minor flooding of agricultural landsbegins.&&

item.title: Flood Warning issued May 30 at 9:49AM CDT until June 03 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Sioux Falls
item.description: ...The National Weather Service in Sioux Falls has issued a floodwarning for the following rivers in Iowa and South DakotaBig Sioux River At HawardenBig Sioux River At AkronOcheyedan River Near SpencerLittle Sioux River Above SpencerLittle Sioux River At Cherokee.The following river forecasts include forecast precipitation throughtonight. Any additional future rains could affect the crestforecasts.Recent rainfall has resulted in rising river levels along the Big SiouxRiver...Little Sioux River...and Ocheyedan River in southeast South Dakotaand northwest Iowa. Continued rises are expected over the next few dayswith additional rainfall forecast this afternoon and tonight.The National Weather Service in Sioux Falls has issued a* Flood Warning forThe Little Sioux River At Cherokee.* From Wednesday afternoon to Friday morning.* At 8AM Monday the stage was 14.3 feet.* Minor flooding is forecast.* Flood stage is 17.0 feet.* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by 1 PM Wednesday and crest near17.1 feet by Wednesday June 1. The river will fall below floodstage by Thursday June 2.* At stages near 17.0 feet...Minor lowland flooding begins, andCherokee County Rescue mobilizes and sets up the flood controlcenter.&&

item.title: Flood Warning issued May 30 at 11:35AM CDT until further notice by NWS NorthPlatte
item.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers inNebraska...North Platte River near Lisco affecting Garden County.North Platte River at Lewellen affecting Garden and KeithCounties.North Platte River near North Platte affecting Lincoln County.Platte River at Brady North Channel affecting Lincoln County..Minor to moderate flooding will continue along the NorthPlatte river...upstream and downstream of Lake McConaughy. Theflooding is due to increased releases from reservoirs in Wyoming andfrom Lake McConaughy. The combined flow from the North Platte riverand the South Platte river will continue to produce minor flooding onthe Platte river near Brady.The Flood Warning continues forThe North Platte River near North Platte.* until further notice.* At 11:00 AM Monday the stage was 6.8 feet.* Flood stage is 6.0 feet.* Moderate flooding is occurring and Moderate flooding is forecast.* Forecast...The river will continue rising to near 6.8 feet by thisafternoon and then remain steady.* Impact...At 7.0 feet...Major and widespread flooding occurs alongthe north bank of the North Platte River from Highway 83 to about 4miles west of Highway 83 south of North River Road. Waterencroaches into some residences and outbuildings in this area withaccess to properties significantly impaired. Major and widespreadflooding occurs along the south bank from the Nebraska Game andParks Recreational Vehicle Campground Site to Cody Park in NorthPlatte.&&
item.dc:creator: w-nws.webmaster@noaa.gov

item.description: * Flood Warning continues forThe North Platte River near Mitchell.* For the North Platte River near Mitchell, Moderate flooding isoccurring, with an estimated stage of 8.8 feet measured at 10 AM Monday.* Moderate flooding is forecast.* The river will remain steady around 8.8 feet during the next couple of days.* Impact...at 9.5 feet...Major flooding occurs across southernportions of Scottsbluff. Major flooding of homes and agriculturalland occurs near the river. Flood wave travel time from Mitchell toScottsbluff is about 10 to 12 hours.* Flood history...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.0 feeton Jun 20 2010.&&

item.title: veille d'orages violents en vigueur severe thunderstorm watch in effect
item.description: Les conditions sont propices à la formation d'orages violents pouvant produire des rafales fortes.De fortes rafales peuvent projeter des objets non fixés, endommager des bâtiments peu solides, arracher des branches d'arbres et renverser de gros véhicules. De la grêle est également possible. De la pluie forte par endroits est également possible.Une veille d'orages violents est émise lorsque les conditions atmosphériques sont propices à la formation d'orages qui pourraient s'accompagner d'au moins un des éléments suivants : grosse grêle, vents destructeurs ou pluies torrentielles.Veuillez continuer à surveiller les alertes et les prévisions émises par Environnement Canada. Pour signaler du temps violent, envoyez un courriel à tempsviolent.quebec@ec.gc.ca ou publiez un gazouillis avec le mot-clic #météoqc. Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts.Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Hail is also possible. Locally heavy rain is also possible.Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to tempsviolent.quebec@ec.gc.ca or tweet reports to #meteoqc.
item.dc:creator: cap-pac@ec.gc.ca

item.title: Flash flood Warning for South Central San Bernardino, Western Riverside, and North Central San Diego Counties in Southwest California
item.description: On Tuesday, Aug. 14, 2007 the National Weather Service issued a flash flood warning for south central San Bernardino county and western Riverside county and north central San Diego county in Southwest California. This warning includes, but is not limited to, the cities of East Hemet, Forest Falls, Idyllwild, Valle Vista, Cherry Valley, Beaumont and Banning. The warning is effective until 4:30 pm pdt. The watersheds recently burned by the Esperanza fire will be particularly susceptible to flash floods and debris flows during the rainstorms. Communities of Beaumont and Banning, located adjacent to the burned area, includeing Smith canyon and Potrero creek may be affected by these events. Roads that cross burned drainages are also susceptible to flash flooding and debris flows. These include, but are not limited to; Beaumont ave., Circle C rd., Castille Cyn rd., Highland Springs ave., Old Banning Idyllwild rd., shirleon dr., Poppet Flats rd., state Highway 243, Cryer drive and Mt. Edna rd.
item.dc:creator: echristian@usgs.gov

item.title: طارئ - إخلاء بسبب الفيضان - تحذيرحول نهر دجلة. يجب التوجه إلى المناطق المرتفعة فوراً
item.description: انهيار سد الموصل. فيضان كبير في نهر دجلة سوف يؤثر في المناطق التالية: قد يصل ارتفاع المياه في الموصل إلى 25 متر خلال 4 ساعات، في تكريت إلى 15 متر خلال 22 ساعة، و في بغداد إلى 4 أمتار خلال 45 ساعة.
item.dc:creator: Eliot.Christian@redcross.org

item.dc:creator: Eliot.Christian@redcross.org

item.title: Acîlîyet- valakirina tofan - Hişyarî ji bo Çemê Dîcleyê - Derhal herin ji bo erdê bilindtir
item.description: Bendava Mûsilê çûye. Lehiyê bi hêz çemê Dîcle tesîrê dê: Mûsilê ji 25 metre di nava 4 saetan, Tikrît ji 15 metre di nava 22 saetan, Bexdayê ji 4 metre di nava 45 saetan.
